ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How often are you reminded of the loved one that you lost by everyday objects, places, and occurrences?
How often do you find yourself wishing that things could be the way they were when you were with the loved one that you lost?
How often are you distracted from things that are happening around you because you are thinking about the loved one that you lost?
How often do you daydream about the loved one that you lost?
How often is it hard for you to be happy without the loved one that you lost?
How often do you feel like things used to be so perfect before you lost the loved one that you lost?
How often do you feel like that in your ideal world, losing the loved one that you lost would never have happened?
How often do you imagine and choose things you would be willing to give up in exchange for having the loved one that you lost back?
How often do you feel separate from the world around you without the loved one that you lost?
How often is the feeling of wanting the loved one that you lost back so strong It is indescribable?
How often do you like to imagine what you would do if the loved one that you lost were with you?
How often are you much more engaged in a conversation if it is about the loved one that you lost?
How often do you feel that there just is no one else who can love you the way the loved one that you lost did?
How often do you wish you could do the things you used to do with the loved one that you lost?
How often do you feel like it would be impossible to find another person that would make you feel the same way as the loved one that you lost did?
How often do you miss the loved one that you lost as much or more than you have missed any other person?
How often do you feel alone without the loved one that you lost?
How often do you not feel like going out as much without the loved one that you lost?
How often is it hard to imagine feeling as comfortable and happy as you were when you were with the loved one that you lost?
How often do you feel like if the loved one that you lost were here, you would know what to do about things?
How often do you lfeel like you could be completely happy if you were with the loved one that you lost?
Yearning in Situations of Loss Scale - Bereaved Total Score
